comments.author: crackfoo
comments.body: Hi, We've added Kawkaw (KAW) to http://zpool.ca/algo/kawpow. See below for connection details.Fee only: 0.5% or lessBTC payouts are processed once a day for balances above 0.0015Payouts for all other currencies are made automatically every 4 hours for balances above 0.05 and balances more than 0.0125 are included in one of the payouts each day.- Sample configurations -To mine kawpow and get paid in KAW:Code:-a kawpow -o stratum+tcp://kawpow.mine.zpool.ca:1325 -u KAW_ADDRESS -p c=KAW,zap=KAW Exchange to BTC:Code:-a kawpow -o stratum+tcp://kawpow.mine.zpool.ca:1325 -u BTC_ADDRESS -p c=BTCAll of our ports are NiceHash friendly, no need to specify any extra detailsSSL/TLS is available for all ports. Simply prepend the port with a 5. Example for kawpow: 51325==============================Support: https://discord.gg/n45n6Jj Twitter: https://twitter.com/_zpool_

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: "It basically an emergency that this technology be adopted as fast as possible!"Can the dev explain this statement in a more elaborate manner?How can this coin be used in emergency purposes if it is not even available in most exchanges?Or listed in known exchanges? Because a coin is easy to use if you can trade it in top exchanges.But emergency? I don't know what exactly this project is referring to.

comments.author: pigsy
comments.body: I've done some mining. Received 3 transactions into my wallet. My earliest transaction has 1241 confirmations. Yet I have no balance in my wallet. What's up?

comments.author: arch111
comments.created_time: September 07, 2022, 06:20:43 PMLast edit: September 07, 2022, 10:04:00 PM by arch111
comments.body: Anyone got their wallet working on Ubuntu 22.04 out of the box ? Or any linux for that matter that had any kind of updates for past few years.  Lol.It's pretty much a carbon copy of Neoxa core, yet somehow you still manged to mess up Wallet/Core/daemon releases for linux   Seriously ?Makes me wanna question if you have any idea what you guys are actually doing or capable of future development. Not a very good first impression. Kind of sus.

comments.author: arch111
comments.body: Quote from: Viecoin on September 08, 2022, 06:48:50 PMQuote from: arch111 on September 07, 2022, 06:20:43 PMAnyone got their wallet working on Ubuntu 22.04 out of the box ? Or any linux for that matter that had any kind of updates for past few years.  Lol.It's pretty much a carbon copy of Neoxa core, yet somehow you still manged to mess up Wallet/Core/daemon releases for linux   Seriously ?Makes me wanna question if you have any idea what you guys are actually doing or capable of future development. Not a very good first impression. Kind of sus.And Doge is pretty much a carbon copy of LTC and LTC of Tenebrix. Your point?  WAIT!, Why is Doge market cap bigger than the both of them? How many hours a day do you actually spend creating these new bct accounts? How do you know KawKaw is a carbon copy of Neoxa, if you were unsuccessful at compiling the wallet? You should also voice your concerns on discord. Devs are super engaging there.Does Doge wallet/core work on linux out of the box without anything done by the user ? Check. Does Neoxa ? Check. Does KawKaw ? Fail. You are missing the point, no user should need to compile crap or go on lib version linking nonsense. It's not user responsibility to make software work, it's developers responsibility. It's unprofessional & bad tone. Software development 101 concepts really.How it's carbon copy ? Take a look at the code may be. I am not saying one coin superiority over another here. I am talking about poor development, especially when you have fully functional reference sources. Is it that tough to install couple of VMs with different distros  and see how it behaves there and adjust accordingly ? Not at all.
